<sense n="II" id="n8768.1" level="2" opt="n"> <i>flowered, bright-coloured,</i> of womenʼs dress, <foreign lang="greek">ἐσθῆτες, στολή,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0099,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Str.</author> 3.3.7</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,084:304d">2.304d</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">τὰ ἄνθινα</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">ἱμάτια)</foreign> <i>gay-coloured dresses</i> worn by the <foreign lang="greek">ἑταῖραι</foreign> at Athens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1609,001:45" default="NO"><author>Phylarch.</author> 45</bibl>; forbidden at religious festivals, <title>IG</title> 11.1300 (<placeName>Delos</placeName>), ib.5(2).514.6 (Lycosura, <date>ii B.C.</date>); also of dresses worn at the Anthesteria by the Satyrs: hence <foreign lang="greek">τὴν φιλοσοφίαν ἄνθινα ἐνέδυσεν</foreign> he clothed philosophy <i>in motley,</i> of <author>Bion</author>, who delivered his precepts in sarcastic verses, like those used in the satyric drama, <author>Eratosth.</author> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0004,001:4:52" default="NO"><author>D.L.</author> 4.52</bibl>, cf. <author>Thphr.</author> ap. <author>Demetr.</author> Lac.<title>Herc.</title> 1055.15, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0099,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Str.</author> 1.2.2</bibl>. (On the accent <abbr>v.</abbr> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hdn.Gr.</author> 1.182</bibl>.)</sense>
<sense id="n8793.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>gather flowers,</i> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,125:917f">2.917f</bibl>: c.acc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0627,055:16" default="NO"><author>Hp.</author> <title>Ep.</title> 16</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2034,003:2:6" default="NO"><author>Porph.</author> <title>Abst.</title> 2.6</bibl>:—<gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="voice" opt="n">Med.</gram></gramGrp>, of bees, <i>gather honey from flowers,</i> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,014:628b:32" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>HA</title> 628b32</bibl>:—<gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="voice" opt="n">Pass.</gram></gramGrp>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4080,001:11:26:2" default="NO"><title>Gp.</title> 11.26.2</bibl>.</sense>
<cit><quote lang="greek">ἀ. καὶ πολύπορος</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,125:916e">2.916e</bibl></cit>.
<sense id="n8864.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>human,</i> <cit><quote lang="greek">ἔργα</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1596,001:11" default="NO"><author>Philol.</author> 11</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,007:268d" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>Sph.</title> 268d</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">ἡ ἀ. ἀρετή</quote> <title>EN</title> 1102b12</cit>, cf. 1178a21, al.: <foreign lang="greek">ἀνθρωπικόν [ἐστι</foreign>], c. <mood opt="n">inf.</mood>, <i>it is like a man, suited to manʼs nature,</i> ib.1163b24, al.: <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="comp" opt="n">Comp.</gram></gramGrp> <itype lang="greek">-κώτεροι</itype>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">οἱ</gen>, the <i>commoner specimens of humanity,</i> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2000,001:2:9:9" default="NO"><author>Plot.</author> 2.9.9</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">ἀ. μῦθος</foreign> a play <i>dealing with human characters,</i> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,012:3D" default="NO"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 3D.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">παρασκευή</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1608,001:p.135B" default="NO"><author>Phryn.</author> <title>PS</title> p.135B.</bibl></cit> <pos opt="n">Adv.</pos> <cit><quote lang="greek">-κῶς</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0062,057:4" default="NO"><author>Luc.</author> <title>Zeux.</title> 4</bibl></cit>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,132:999b">2.999b</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2034,003:3:4" default="NO"><author>Porph.</author> <title>Abst.</title> 3.4</bibl>.</sense>

<sense n="IV" id="n14954.6" level="2" opt="n"> <foreign lang="greek">ἀρέσκει</foreign> is used impers. to express <i>the opinion</i> or <i>resolution</i> of a public body, <cit><quote lang="greek">ταῦτα ἤρεσέ σφι ποιέειν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hdt.</author> 8.19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">ἢν δʼ ἀρέσκῃ ταῦτʼ Ἀθηναίοις</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,002:1311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Eq.</title> 1311</bibl></cit>; <foreign lang="greek">ἀρέσκει . . εἶναι Δελφῶν</foreign> <i>it is resolved</i> that . . , <title>SIG</title> 827<title>D</title> 10; also of <i>prevailing opinions,</i> <foreign lang="greek">ἀρέσκει περὶ τρίψεως παραγγέλλοντας</foreign> . . writers on massage <i>lay down the rule</i> that . . , <author>Gal.</author> 6.96; <foreign lang="greek">τὰ ἀρέσκοντα</foreign> the <i>dogmas</i> of philosophers, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,094:448a">2.448a</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,133:1006d">1006d</bibl>, etc.:—<gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="voice" opt="n">Med.</gram></gramGrp>, <cit><quote lang="greek">ἐξεῖναι παρʼ ὁποτέρους ἂν ἀρέσκηται ἐλθεῖν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0003,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Th.</author> 1.35</bibl></cit>. </sense>

<div2 id="crossdiami/gnu_mi" orig_id="n25275" key="diami/gnu_mi" type="main" opt="n"><head extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n" orth_orig="διαμίγνῡμι">διαμίγνυμι</head> or <orth extent="suff" lang="greek" opt="n">διαμιγνύω</orth> (<author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0094,002:1131e">2.1131e</bibl>), <tns opt="n">fut.</tns> <foreign lang="greek">-μίξω,</foreign> <sense id="n25275.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>to mix up,</i> l.c.:— <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="voice" opt="n">Pass.</gram></gramGrp>, <cit><quote lang="greek">διαμεμιγμέναι</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0497,001:174:9" default="NO"><author>Pl.Com.</author> 174.9</bibl></cit> codd. <author>Ath.</author>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">διαμίσγω.</foreign></sense></div2>

 

<sense id="n25279.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>one must contend,</i> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,118:817d">2.817d</bibl>.</sense>
<cit><quote lang="greek">παλίμψηστα</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,101:504d">2.504d</bibl></cit>.
<cit><quote lang="greek">πρὸς ἀδελφούς</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,097:482c">2.482c</bibl></cit>, cf.

<div2 id="crosse)ndu_ma/tia" orig_id="n35306" key="e)ndu_ma/tia" type="main" opt="n"><head extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n" orth_orig="ἐνδῡμάτια">ἐνδυμάτια</head>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">τά</gen>, name of a musical festival at Argos, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0094,002:1134c">2.1134c</bibl>.</div2>

<cit><quote lang="greek">τινά τινι</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,082:233e">2.233e</bibl></cit>.

(v.l. γενόμενον). (Prob. from same root as <foreign lang="greek">ἵκω</foreign>.)</sense></div2>

<sense n="4" id="n51792.8" level="3" opt="n"> <pos opt="n">Adv.</pos> <tns opt="n">pres.</tns> <mood opt="n">part.</mood> <foreign lang="greek">καθηκόντως</foreign> <i>fittingly, properly</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0537,006:2p.53U" default="NO"><author>Epicur.</author> <title>Ep.</title> 2p.53U.</bibl>, <title>OGI</title> 90.28(Rosetta, <date>ii B.C.</date>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0543,001:5:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plb.</author> 5.9.6</bibl>, <abbr>v.l. in</abbr> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0060,001:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>D.S.</author> 1.93</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">πρός τι</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2034,003:1:43" default="NO"><author>Porph.</author> <title>Abst.</title> 1.43</bibl></cit>; <i>consistently with duty,</i> <author>Stoic.</author> 3.188, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,094:448e">2.448e</bibl>; <i>appropriately</i>, c. dat., <foreign lang="greek">τῷ τόπῳ</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1183,001:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Aristeas</author> 81</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">κ. ἔχειν πρός τι</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1183,001:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Id.</author> 87</bibl></cit>. </sense>
<cit><quote lang="greek">ζῴων</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,089:380d">2.380d</bibl></cit> (pl.).

<div2 id="crosskatatetrai/nw" orig_id="n55400" key="katatetrai/nw" type="main" opt="n"><head extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n" orth_orig="κατατετραίνω">κατατετραίνω</head>, found as <tns opt="n">pres.</tns> only in the form <orth extent="suff" lang="greek" opt="n">κατα-τιτράω</orth> <author>Gal.</author> 11.402: <tns opt="n">aor. 1</tns> -<itype lang="greek" opt="n">έτρησα</itype> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:689c">2.689c</bibl>:—<sense id="n55400.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>bore through, perforate</i>, ll.cc.: usu. in <tns opt="n">pf.</tns> <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="voice" opt="n">Pass.</gram></gramGrp>, <foreign lang="greek">σήραγγας κατατετρημένας</foreign> cavities <i>bored through</i> it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,031:70c" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>Ti.</title> 70c</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0099,001:15:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Str.</author> 15.1.36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">ὁ πλεύμων πόροις κατατέτρηται</quote> <author>Plu.</author> 2.699a</cit>.</sense></div2>

<div2 id="crosskw/mion" orig_id="n61300" key="kw/mion" type="main" opt="n"><head extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n" orth_orig="κώμιον">κώμιον</head>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">τό</gen>, <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dim" opt="n">Dim. of</gram></gramGrp> <foreign lang="greek">κώμη</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0099,001:10:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Str.</author> 10.5.3</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,114:773b">2.773b</bibl>.</div2>

 

<sense id="n61314.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>treat after the manner of <foreign lang="greek">κωμῳδοί</foreign>:</i> hence, <i>satirize, lampoon, ridicule</i>, <cit><quote lang="greek">κωμῳδεῖ τὴν πόλιν ἡμῶν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,001:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Ach.</title> 631</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,030:395e" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>R.</title> 395e</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,030:452d" default="NO" valid="yes">452d</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0545,002:13:43" default="NO"><author>Ael.</author> <title>VH</title> 13.43</bibl>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="greek">κ. τοὺς τραγῳδούς</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,034:1458b:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Po.</title> 1458b32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">κ. τινὰ ἐπί τινι</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:8:344e" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 8.344e</bibl></cit>, cf. <sense id="n61862.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>clear-voiced</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0627,002:5" default="NO"><author>Hp.</author> <title>Aër.</title> 5</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,121:840a">2.840a</bibl>: <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="comp" opt="n">Sup.</gram></gramGrp> -<itype lang="greek" opt="n">ότατος</itype> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0014,018:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>D.</author> 18.313</bibl>:—hence <orth extent="suff" lang="greek" opt="n">λαμπρο-φωνεύομαι</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0087,037:p.436" default="NO"><author>Hdn.</author> <title>Philet.</title> p.436</bibl> P., <author>Hsch.</author> s.v. βαλανεύειν; and <orth extent="suff" lang="greek" opt="n">λαμπρο-φωνία</orth>, <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Ion.</gram></gramGrp> <foreign lang="greek">-ίη</foreign>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">ἡ</gen>, <i>clearness and loudness of voice</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hdt.</author> 6.60</bibl>.</sense>
<cit><quote lang="greek">πολλὰ περὶ τῶν Μηδικῶν ἔργων</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,123:870d">2.870d</bibl></cit>.
<div2 id="crossla_o/s" orig_id="n61925" key="la_o/s" type="main" opt="n"><head extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n" orth_orig="λᾱός">λαός</head>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">ὁ</gen>, <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Ion.</gram></gramGrp> <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">ληός</orth> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0233,001:88" default="NO"><author>Hippon.</author> 88</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hdt.</author> 5.42</bibl> (v.l. λαόν, which is in all Mss. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:4:148" default="NO" valid="yes">4.148</bibl>), cj. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0255,001:14:9" default="NO"><author>Mimn.</author> 14.9</bibl>; <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Att.</gram></gramGrp> <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">λεώς</orth>, which is also used in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hdt.</author> 1.22</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:8:136" default="NO" valid="yes">8.136</bibl>, while the form <foreign lang="greek">λαός</foreign> is sts. used in Trag., and once or twice even in Com. (v. infr. I.3): also in Inscrr. and Pap. (v. infr.) and in late Prose, as Foed.Byz. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0543,001:4:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plb.</author> 4.52.7</bibl> (pl.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0099,001:14:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Str.</author> 14.4.3</bibl> (pl.), <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,139:1096b">2.1096b</bibl>, etc. (both forms in pr. nn., <cit><quote lang="greek">Λεωβώτης</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hdt.</author> 7.204</bibl></cit>, <cit><quote lang="greek">Λαβώτας</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0032,001:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>X.</author> <title>HG</title> 1.2.18</bibl></cit>, etc.). <sense n="1" id="n61925.1" level="3" opt="n"> in <title>Il.</title>, <foreign lang="greek">λαός </foreign> (<etym lang="greek" opt="n">λαοί</etym>) usu. means <i>men</i>, i.e. soldiers, both of the whole army and smaller divisions, <cit><quote lang="greek">κριτὸς ἔγρετο λ. Ἀχαιῶν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:7:434" default="NO" valid="yes">7.434</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">λαὸν ἀγείρειν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:16:129" default="NO" valid="yes">16.129</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">πολὺν ὤλεσα λαόν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes">2.115</bibl></cit>: pl., <foreign lang="greek">ἅμα τῷ γε . . ἄριστοι λ. ἕποντ</foreign>ʼ ib. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:2:578" default="NO" valid="yes">578</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">στίχες ἀσπιστάων λ.</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes">4.91</bibl></cit>; periphr., <foreign lang="greek">στρατὸς λαῶν</foreign> ib. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes">76</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">λαῶν ἔθνος</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:13:495" default="NO" valid="yes">13.495</bibl></cit>; mostly including both <i>foot and horse</i>, as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:2:809" default="NO" valid="yes">2.809</bibl>; but sts. <foreign lang="greek">λαός</foreign> denotes <i>foot</i>, as opp. horse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:7:342" default="NO" valid="yes">7.342</bibl>; also, <i>a land army</i>, opp. a fleet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes">4.76</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:9:424" default="NO" valid="yes">9.424</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes">10.14</bibl>; also, <i>the common men</i>, opp. their leaders, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:2:365" default="NO" valid="yes">2.365</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:13:108" default="NO" valid="yes">13.108</bibl>; but </sense><sense n="2" id="n61925.2" level="3" opt="n"> in <title>Od.</title>, <foreign lang="greek">λαοί</foreign>, more rarely <foreign lang="greek">λαός</foreign>, almost always means <i>men</i> or <i>people</i>; as <i>subjects</i> of a prince, e.g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,002:3:214" default="NO" valid="yes">3.214</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,002:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes">305</bibl>, al. (<foreign lang="greek">λαοί</foreign> is sts. so used in <title>Il.</title>, e.g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:17:226" default="NO" valid="yes">17.226</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:24:611" default="NO" valid="yes">24.611</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">λαοὶ ἀγροιῶται</foreign> country-<i>folk</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:11:676" default="NO" valid="yes">11.676</bibl>; <i>work-people</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:17:390" default="NO" valid="yes">17.390</bibl>); of <i>sailors</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,002:14:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Od.</title> 14.248</bibl>; so after <author>Hom.</author>, <foreign lang="greek">ναυτικὸς λεώς</foreign> seafaring <i>folk</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0085,002:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>A.</author> <title>Pers.</title> 383</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">πᾶς ὁ χειρῶναξ λεώς</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0011,008:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>S.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 844</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">ὁ γεωργικὸς λεώς</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,005:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Pax</title> 920</bibl></cit> (lyr.): in sg., <i>slave</i>, <foreign lang="greek">τὸν Εὐρυσθέως λεών</foreign>, of Heracles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0538,001:23" default="NO"><author>Hecat.</author> 23</bibl> <author>J.</author>; and so perh. <cit><quote lang="greek">λεὼς αὔτοικος</quote> <title>GDI</title> 5533e</cit> (<placeName>Zeleia</placeName>): more generally, <foreign lang="greek">μέροπες λαοί</foreign>, i.e. <i>man</i>kind, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0085,001:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>A.</author> <title>Supp.</title> 90</bibl> (lyr.); <foreign lang="greek">λ. ἐγχώριοι</foreign> the natives, ib. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0085,001:517" default="NO" valid="yes">517</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,002:6:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Od.</title> 6.194</bibl>; esp. in Egypt, of the fellahin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:pap,P.Rev.:42:11" default="NO"><title>PRev.Laws</title> 42.11</bibl>-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:pap,P.Rev.:16" default="NO">16</bibl> <date>(iii B. C.)</date>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:pap,PSI:4:380:5" default="NO"><title>PSI</title> 4.380.5</bibl> <date>(iii B. C.)</date>, etc.; <i>civil population</i>, opp. priests and soldiers, <title>OGI</title> 90.12 (Rosetta, <date>ii B. C.</date>), cf. 225.8 (<placeName>Milet.</placeName>, <date>iii B. C.</date>), al. </sense><sense n="3" id="n61925.3" level="3" opt="n"> <i>people assembled</i>, as in the theatre, <cit><quote lang="greek">ὁ πολὺς λαῶν ὄχλος</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,009:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Ra.</title> 676</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,009:219" default="NO" valid="yes">219</bibl> (both lyr.); esp. in the Ecclesia, <cit><quote lang="greek">αἱ στίχες τῶν λαῶν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,002:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Id.</author> <title>Eq.</title> 163</bibl></cit>: hence the phrase <foreign lang="greek">ἀκούετε λεῴ</foreign> hear <i>O people</i>!—the usual way of beginning proclamations at Athens, like our <i>Oyez</i>! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0264,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sus.</author> 1.1</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,005:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Pax</title> 551</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,006:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Av.</title> 448</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">τιμῶσιν οἱ πάντες λεῴ</foreign> ib. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,006:1275" default="NO" valid="yes">1275</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">δεῦρʼ ἴτε, πάντες λεῴ</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,051:384" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 384</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">Ἀττικὸς λεώς</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0085,007:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>A.</author> <title>Eu.</title> 681</bibl></cit>; <foreign lang="greek">ὁ πολὺς λεώς</foreign> <i>the multitude</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,030:458d" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>R.</title> 458d</bibl>, etc. </sense><sense n="4" id="n61925.4" level="3" opt="n"> in <author>LXX</author>, of <i>the</i>  <i>people</i>, as opp. priests and Levites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,017:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>1 Es.</title> 5.46</bibl>; in <title>NT</title>, of <i>Jews</i>, opp. Gentiles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Ev.Matt.</title> 2.6</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Ev.Luc.</title> 2.10</bibl>, al., cf. <title>SIG</title> 1247 (Jewish tombstones); of <i>Christians</i>, opp. heathen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Act.Ap.</title> 15.14</bibl>, al. </sense><sense n="II" id="n61925.5" level="2" opt="n"> <i>a people</i>, i.e. all who are called by one name, first in <author>Pi.</author>, <cit><quote lang="greek">Δωριεῖ λαῷ</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0033,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>O.</title> 8.30</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">Λυδῶν δὲ λαὸς καὶ Φρυγῶν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0085,002:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>A.</author> <title>Pers.</title> 770</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">ξύμπας Ἀχαιῶν λαός</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0011,006:1243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>S.</author> <title>Ph.</title> 1243</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0011,004:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>OT</title> 144</bibl>, etc.; <foreign lang="greek">ἱππόται λαοί</foreign>, i.e. the Thessalians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0033,002:4:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pi.</author> <title>P.</title> 4.153</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0033,002:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes">9.54</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0033,003:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>N.</title> 1.17</bibl>. (The resemblance between <foreign lang="greek">λαός</foreign> <i>people</i> and <foreign lang="greek">λᾶος</foreign> <i>stone</i> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">λᾶας</foreign>) is implied in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:24:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Il.</title> 24.611</bibl> <foreign lang="greek">λαοὺς δὲ λίθους ποίησε Κρονίων</foreign> (in the story of Niobe); and so <author>Pi.</author> explains the word from the legend of Deucalion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0033,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>O.</title> 9.46</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0521,001:122" default="NO"><author>Epich.</author> 122</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0548,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Apollod.</author> 1.7.2</bibl>; but cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0583,001:12" default="NO"><author>Philoch.</author> 12</bibl>.) (From <itype lang="greek" opt="n">λᾱϝ</itype>-, as shown by the pr.names <cit><quote lang="greek">Λαϝοπτόλεμος</quote> <title>GDI</title> 3151</cit>, <foreign lang="greek">ϝιόλαϝος</foreign> ib.3132 (<placeName>Corinth</placeName>): hence prob. <foreign lang="greek">λήϊτον</foreign>.)</sense></div2>

<sense id="n61949.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>scum</i> which forms on the surface of wine, vinegar, or other liquids left to stand, <author>Erot.</author>: <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">λάμπη</orth> in <author>Dsc.</author> 5.76, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,138:1073a">2.1073a</bibl>, <author>Gal.</author> 16.704, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0722,004:9:13:2" default="NO"><author>Orib.</author> <title>Syn.</title> 9.13.2</bibl>:—hence <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">λαμπῶδες</orth>, of urine, <i>with a scum on it</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0627,017:182" default="NO"><author>Hp.</author> <title>Coac.</title> 182</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0627,016:1:92" default="NO"><title>Prorrh.</title> 1.92</bibl>; but Erot. read <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">λαπῶδες</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">λαππώδης</orth> (<foreign lang="greek">ἀπὸ τοῦ λάππειν) </foreign> occurs in Gal. l.c. </sense>

<sense n="II" id="n70987.1" level="2" opt="n"> <i>code of laws,</i> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0540,030:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lys.</author> 30.35</bibl>, <title>Com.Adesp.</title> 110.2, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>LXX</author> <title>2 Ma.</title> 6.23</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,082:240b">2.240b</bibl>. </sense>

<gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Ep.</gram></gramGrp> <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">οὔρειος</orth>:—<sense id="n74825.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>of</i> or <i>from the mountains, mountain-haunting,</i> <cit><quote lang="greek">νύμφην οὐρείην</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0013,004:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>h.Merc.</title> 244</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0020,007:198" default="NO"><author>Hes.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 198</bibl>, Phoronis <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0020,007:2" default="NO">2</bibl> ; this <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Ep.</gram></gramGrp> form is also used by Trag. and Com. in lyr., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0011,002:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>S.</author> <title>Ant.</title> 352</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0006,013:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>E.</author> <title>IT</title> 127</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0006,013:1126" default="NO" valid="yes">1126</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0006,015:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Ph.</title> 806</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,006:1098" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Av.</title> 1098</bibl>, etc.; but <foreign lang="greek">ὄρειος</foreign> (which is not only <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Att.</gram></gramGrp> but <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Ion.</gram></gramGrp>, <abbr>v.</abbr> infr.) in trim., as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0085,005:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>A.</author> <title>Ag.</title> 497</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0011,006:937" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>S.</author> <title>Ph.</title> 937</bibl> ; <foreign lang="greek">Μήτηρ ὀρεία,</foreign> of Rhea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,006:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Av.</title> 746</bibl> (lyr.); <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Ion.</gram></gramGrp> gen., <cit><quote lang="greek">Μητρὸς Ὀρέης</quote> <title>IG</title> 12(7).75</cit> (<placeName>Amorgos</placeName>); <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Ion.</gram></gramGrp>acc. pl., <cit><quote lang="greek">πέτρας ὀρείας</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0233,001:35:5" default="NO"><author>Hippon.</author> 35.5</bibl></cit> : in Prose, <cit><quote lang="greek">ὄρειοί τινες . . νομῆς</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,034:677b" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>Lg.</title> 677b</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,032:109d" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Criti.</title> 109d</bibl> ; opp. <foreign lang="greek">ἄγροικος,</foreign> of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,014:488b:2" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>HA</title> 488b2</bibl> ; so <cit><quote lang="greek">ὀρειότερος</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0024,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Opp.</author> <title>C.</title> 2.22</bibl></cit>.</sense></div2>

(I.-E. <i>pōy</i>- and <i>pī</i>-, cf. Skt. <i>pāy-áyati</i> ‘cause to drink’, <i>pīti</i>- ‘a drink’, Lat. <foreign lang="la">pōtus</foreign>, etc.)</sense></div2>

 

<sense id="n83280.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>flavoured with pitch</i>, <cit><quote lang="greek">οἶνος</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0099,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Str.</author> 4.6.2</bibl></cit>, <author>Dsc.</author> 5.38, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:676c">2.676c</bibl>.</sense>
<cit><quote lang="greek">φυτά</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:648d">2.648d</bibl></cit>.
<cit><quote lang="greek">π. περὶ θεῶν ἔχειν</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,139:1101c">2.1101c</bibl></cit>. 
<cit><quote lang="greek">τι] ταῖς Αἰσχύλου ἐλεγείαις</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:628e">2.628e</bibl></cit> ; 
<cit><quote lang="greek">π. στέφανος</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:677b">2.677b</bibl></cit>; 
<sense id="n83378.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>pine</i>, esp. <i>Pinus Laricio, Corsican pine</i>, <cit><quote lang="greek">π. βλωθρή, τήν τʼ οὔρεσι τέκτονες ἄνδρες ἐξέταμον</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:13:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Il.</title> 13.390</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="greek">μακρῇσίν τε πίτυσσιν ἰδὲ δρυσίν</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,002:9:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Od.</title> 9.186</bibl></cit>; also, <i>Aleppo pine, P. halepensis</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0093,001:3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Thphr.</author> <title>HP</title> 3.9.5</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0022,002:301" default="NO"><author>Nic.</author> <title>Al.</title> 301</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0525,001:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Paus.</author> 2.1.3</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4080,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><title>Gp.</title> 2.8.2</bibl> (called <cit><quote lang="greek">π. ἀγρία</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0093,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Thphr.</author> <title>HP</title> 1.9.3</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0093,001:3:3:1" default="NO">3.3.1</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0525,001:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Paus.</author> 5.6.4</bibl>); the <i>Isthmian pine</i> was one species, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1240,001:2" default="NO"><author>Callix.</author> 2</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:675e">2.675e</bibl>: prov., <foreign lang="greek">πίτυος τρόπον ἐκτρίβειν</foreign> like <i>a pine</i>, i.e. <i>utterly</i>, because the pine when cut down never grows again, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hdt.</author> 6.37</bibl> (but this is attributed to the <foreign lang="greek">πεύκη</foreign>, and not to the <foreign lang="greek">πίτυς</foreign>, by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0093,001:3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Thphr.</author> <title>HP</title> 3.9.5</bibl>).</sense>

whereas the <tns opt="n">aor. 2</tns> <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="voice" opt="n">Pass.</gram></gramGrp> <foreign lang="greek">ἐπλήγην</foreign> is used instead of <foreign lang="greek">ἐπαίσθην, ἐπατάχθην,</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">ἐτύφθην </foreign> (<etym lang="greek" opt="n">ἐτύπην</etym>): hence <cit><quote lang="greek">παίσαντές τε καὶ πληγέντες</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0011,002:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>S.</author> <title>Ant.</title> 172</bibl></cit>; <div2 id="crossproiki/dion" orig_id="n87561" key="proiki/dion" type="main" opt="n"><head extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n" orth_orig="προικ-ίδιον">προικίδιον</head>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">τό</gen>, <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dim" opt="n">Dim. of</gram></gramGrp> <foreign lang="greek">προίξ,</foreign> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,113:767c">2.767c</bibl>.</div2>

<sense id="n91905.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>question</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0018,001:1:99" default="NO"><author>Ph.</author> 1.99</bibl>, al., <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,091:408c">2.408c</bibl> (pl.): distd. fr. <foreign lang="greek">ἐρώτημα</foreign>, as requiring an explanatory answer, and not merely assent or dissent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0544,001:1:189" default="NO"><author>S.E.</author> <title>P.</title> 1.189</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0594,002:1:23" default="NO"><author>Alex.</author> <title>Fig.</title> 1.23</bibl>, <author>Anon.</author> <title>Fig.</title> 18p.179S. </sense>

<sense id="n95057.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>song which went round crookedly at banquets</i>, being sung to the lyre by the guests one after another in irregular order, the singer holding a myrtlebranch (<etym lang="greek" opt="n">μυρρίνη</etym>) passed to him by the previous singer, <cit><quote lang="greek">ᾆσον δή μοι σ. τι λαβὼν Ἀλκαίον κἀνακρέοντος</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,012:223" default="NO"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 223</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,035:1285a:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Pol.</title> 1285a38</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:15:694a" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 15.694a</bibl>; the word first in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0033,005:122:11" default="NO"><author>Pi.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 122.11</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0088,004:66" default="NO"><author>Aristox.</author> <title>Fr.Hist.</title> 66</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:13:573f" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 13.573f</bibl>); examples in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0199,004:1361" default="NO"><author>B.</author> <title>Scol.Oxy.</title> 1361</bibl>, Bergk <title>PLG</title> iii pp. 643 sqq., cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,001:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Ach.</title> 532</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,009:1302" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Ra.</title> 1302</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,004:1222" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>V.</title> 1222</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,023:451e" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>Grg.</title> 451e</bibl> (cf. Sch. ad loc.); <foreign lang="greek">τὰ Ἀττικὰ ἐκεῖνα σ</foreign>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:15:693f" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 15.693f</bibl>. (The name was variously expld.: (a) from <foreign lang="greek">σκολιός</foreign> <i>crooked</i>, because of the <i>crooked</i> order of the singers, the bad singers being passed over, or the couches being crookedly arranged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0066,001:43" default="NO"><author>Dicaearch.Hist.</author> 43</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0088,004:59" default="NO"><author>Aristox.</author> <title>Fr.Hist.</title> 59</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:615c">2.615c</bibl>, Sch. Pl. l.c. (b) later, the omission of the bad singers being ascribed to the difficulty or non-social character of the songs (cf. <author>Plu.</author> 2.615b), <foreign lang="greek">σκόλιον</foreign> was derived from <foreign lang="greek">δύσκολον</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">δυσκολία</foreign>, <author>Hsch.</author>, Sch. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,004:1217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>V.</title> 1217</bibl>; or it was said that the songs were easy, but appeared difficult to drunken revellers, <author>Procl.</author> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4040,001:p.321" default="NO"><author>Phot.</author> <title>Bibl.</title> p.321</bibl> B.; or were called difficult <foreign lang="greek">κατʼ ἀντίφρασιν</foreign>, <author>Procl.</author> l.c., <author>Suid.</author>) </sense>
<sense id="n95057.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>song which went round crookedly at banquets</i>, being sung to the lyre by the guests one after another in irregular order, the singer holding a myrtlebranch (<etym lang="greek" opt="n">μυρρίνη</etym>) passed to him by the previous singer, <cit><quote lang="greek">ᾆσον δή μοι σ. τι λαβὼν Ἀλκαίον κἀνακρέοντος</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,012:223" default="NO"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 223</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,035:1285a:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Pol.</title> 1285a38</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:15:694a" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 15.694a</bibl>; the word first in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0033,005:122:11" default="NO"><author>Pi.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 122.11</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0088,004:66" default="NO"><author>Aristox.</author> <title>Fr.Hist.</title> 66</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:13:573f" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 13.573f</bibl>); examples in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0199,004:1361" default="NO"><author>B.</author> <title>Scol.Oxy.</title> 1361</bibl>, Bergk <title>PLG</title> iii pp. 643 sqq., cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,001:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Ach.</title> 532</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,009:1302" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Ra.</title> 1302</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,004:1222" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>V.</title> 1222</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,023:451e" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>Grg.</title> 451e</bibl> (cf. Sch. ad loc.); <foreign lang="greek">τὰ Ἀττικὰ ἐκεῖνα σ</foreign>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:15:693f" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 15.693f</bibl>. (The name was variously expld.: (a) from <foreign lang="greek">σκολιός</foreign> <i>crooked</i>, because of the <i>crooked</i> order of the singers, the bad singers being passed over, or the couches being crookedly arranged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0066,001:43" default="NO"><author>Dicaearch.Hist.</author> 43</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0088,004:59" default="NO"><author>Aristox.</author> <title>Fr.Hist.</title> 59</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:615c">2.615c</bibl>, Sch. Pl. l.c. the <itype lang="greek" opt="n">σ</itype>. and its name are confused by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0082,004:29:1" default="NO"><author>A.D.</author> <title>Synt.</title> 29.1</bibl>, but distd. by <author>Hdn.Gr.</author> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4093,001:1:340" default="NO"><author>Choerob.</author> <title>in Theod.</title> 1.340</bibl>, Sch. <author>D.T.</author> l.c.:—<cit><quote lang="greek">κατὰ στοιχεῖον</quote> <i>in the order of the letters, alphabetically,</i> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,7000,001:11:15" default="NO"><title>AP</title> 11.15</bibl></cit> (<author>Ammian.</author>); dub.sens. in <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,092:422e">2.422e</bibl>. </sense>
<sense n="2" id="n96929.3" level="3" opt="n"> in Physics, <foreign lang="greek">στοιχεῖα</foreign> were the <i>components into which matter is ultimately divisible, elements</i>, reduced to four by Empedocles, who called them <foreign lang="greek">ῥιζὤματα</foreign>, the word <foreign lang="greek">στοιχεῖα</foreign> being first used (acc. to <author>Eudem.</author> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4013,004:7:13" default="NO"><author>Simp.</author> <title>in Ph.</title> 7.13</bibl>) by <author>Pl.</author>, <foreign lang="greek">τὰ πρῶτα οἱονπερεὶ σ., ἐξ ὧν ἡμεῖς τε σγκείμεθα καὶ τἄλλα</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,006:201e" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Tht.</title> 201e</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">τὰ τῶν πάντων σ</foreign>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,008:278d" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Plt.</title> 278d</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">αὐτὰ τιθέμενοι σ. τοῦ παντός</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,031:48b" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Ti.</title> 48b</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,013:314a:29" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>GC</title> 314a29</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,025:998a:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Metaph.</title> 998a28</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0093,003:3" default="NO"><author>Thphr.</author> <title>Sens.</title> 3</bibl>, al., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0004,001:3:24" default="NO"><author>D.L.</author> 3.24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">σ. σωματικά</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,026:338a:22" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Mete.</title> 338a22</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0093,010:46" default="NO"><author>Thphr.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 46</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">ἄτομα σ</foreign>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0537,006:2p.36U" default="NO"><author>Epicur.</author> <title>Ep.</title> 2p.36U.</bibl>; equivalent to <foreign lang="greek">ἀρχαί</foreign>, Thales ap. <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,124:875c">2.875c</bibl>, <author>Anaximand.</author> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0004,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>D.L.</author> 2.1</bibl>, <author>Anon.</author> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,031:188b:28" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Ph.</title> 188b28</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,025:1059b:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Metaph.</title> 1059b23</bibl>, al.; but <author>Arist.</author> also distinguishes <itype lang="greek" opt="n">σ</itype>. from <foreign lang="greek">ἀρχή</foreign> as less comprehensive, ib.1070b23; <foreign lang="greek">τὰ σ. ὕλη τῆς οὐσίας</foreign> ib.1088b27; <foreign lang="greek">τρία τὰ σ</foreign>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,031:189b:16" default="NO"><author>Id.</author> <title>Ph.</title> 189b16</bibl>; distd. from <foreign lang="greek">ἀρχή</foreign> on other grounds by <title>Stoic.</title> 2.111; <itype lang="greek" opt="n">σ</itype>. used in three senses by Chrysipp., ib.136, cf. Zeno ib.1.24, al.; in Medicine, <author>Gal.</author> 6.3, 420, al., 15.7, al.; <cit><quote lang="greek">Αἰθέρ, κόσμου σ. ἄριστον</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0579,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Orph.</author> <title>H.</title> 5.4</bibl></cit>; <foreign lang="greek">ἀνηλεὲς σ</foreign>., of the sea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0614,001:71:4" default="NO"><author>Babr.</author> 71.4</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">τὸ σ</foreign>., of the sea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1617,001:44" default="NO"><author>Polem.</author> <title>Cyn.</title> 44</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">ἄμφω τὰ σ</foreign>., i.e. land and sea, ib. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1617,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0015,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Hdn.</author> 3.1.5</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2051,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Him.</author> <title>Ecl.</title> 2.18</bibl>. </sense>

<div2 id="crosssuggeni/s" orig_id="n97510" key="suggeni/s" type="main" opt="n"><head extent="suff" lang="greek" opt="n" orth_orig="συγγεν-ίς">συγγενίς</head>, <itype lang="greek" opt="n">ίδος</itype>, pecul. fem. of <foreign lang="greek">συγγενής</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Ev.Luc.</title> 1.36</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,084:265d">2.265d</bibl>, <title>CIG</title> 2995 (<placeName>Ephesus</placeName>), <title>IG</title> 14.829 (<placeName>Puteoli</placeName>), 3.479, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:pap,P.Amh.:2:78:9" default="NO"><title>PAmh.</title> 2.78.9</bibl> <date>(ii A.D.)</date>; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0542,001:3:30" default="NO"><author>Poll.</author> 3.30</bibl>, <foreign lang="greek">ἐσχάτως βάρβαρον</foreign>.</div2>

<cit><quote lang="greek">πρὸς δόξαν</quote> <author>Id.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,139:1100a">2.1100a</bibl></cit>; 
<sense n="3" id="n101560.2" level="3" opt="n"> <i>hollow sphere</i> or <i>globe</i>: in the Ancient Physics, from the time of Anaximander (cf. <title>Placit.</title> 2.16.5), of the <i>spheres</i> believed to revolve round the earth carrying the heavenly bodies, and according to the Pythagoreans arranged after the intervals of the musical scale (cf. <author>Alex.Eph.</author> ap. Theon.Sm. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0698,001:p.139" default="NO">p.139</bibl> H., <author>Cic.</author> <title>de Rep.</title> 6.18), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,025:1073b:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Metaph.</title> 1073b18</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,005:286b:24" default="NO"><title>Cael.</title> 286b24</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,026:341b:20" default="NO"><title>Mete.</title> 341b20</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,026:354b:24" default="NO">354b24</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0093,005:4" default="NO"><author>Thphr.</author> <title>Ign.</title> 4</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">σ. ἀπλανής,</foreign> = ἡ τῶν ἀπλανῶν σ. the <i>sphere</i> of the fixed stars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4036,002:5:1" default="NO"><author>Procl.</author> <title>Hyp.</title> 5.1</bibl>; so <foreign lang="greek">ἡ ἀπλανής</foreign>, without σ., ib. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4036,002:7:25" default="NO">7.25</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">αἱ πλανώμεναι σ</foreign>. planetary <i>spheres</i>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,134:1028a">2.1028a</bibl>; Astrol., <foreign lang="greek">ἡ ὀρθὴ σ</foreign>. right <i>sphere</i>, i.e. the celestial sphere as viewed from the equator, Rhetorius in <title>Cat.Cod.Astr.</title> 8(1).231. </sense>

not found in <title>NT</title>: acc. to Thom.Mag.p.328 R. <foreign lang="greek">σῶς</foreign> is <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Att.</gram></gramGrp> for <foreign lang="greek">σῶος, σῶν</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">σῶον</foreign> (masc. and neut.), <foreign lang="greek">σῶς</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">σώους</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">σώας</foreign>, but all other <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Att.</gram></gramGrp> forms are un<gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="var" opt="n">contr.</gram></gramGrp> (<etym lang="greek" opt="n">σῶοι, σῶα</etym>): the form <foreign lang="greek">σῷος</foreign> is recommended by <author>Did.</author> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4099,001:741:43" default="NO"><title>EM</title> 741.43</bibl>, but rejected by Hdn.Gr.ib. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,4099,001:46" default="NO">46</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hdn.Gr.</author> 2.53</bibl>), and is found in cod. <foreign lang="greek">Σ</foreign> of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0014,018:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>D.</author> 18.49</bibl>, al.; <sense n="II" id="n103591.1" level="2" opt="n"> <pos opt="n">Subst.</pos> <orth lang="greek">-χορδον</orth>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">τό</gen>, <i>tetrachord</i>, i.e. <i>scale of four notes</i>, comprising two tones and a half, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,036:922b:8" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Pr.</title> 922b8</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,051:47" default="NO"><title>Fr.</title> 47</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,134:1021e">2.1021e</bibl>, etc.: metaph., (sc. <foreign lang="greek">παθῶν</foreign>) <author>Aristo Stoic.</author> 1.85, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2003,003:315c" default="NO"><author>Jul.</author> <title>Caes.</title> 315c</bibl>.</sense>
<sense id="n103637.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>cicala, Cicada plebeia</i> or allied species, a winged insect fond of basking on trees, when the male makes a chirping or clicking noise by means of certain drums or ‘tymbals’ underneath the wings, whence the joke in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0518,001:14" default="NO"><author>Xenarch.</author> 14</bibl>, <foreign lang="greek">εἶτʼ . . οἱ τέττιγες οὐκ εὐδαίμονες, ὧν ταῖς γυναιξὶν οὐδʼ ὁτιοῦν φωνῆς ἔνι</foreign>; prov., <cit><quote lang="greek">τέττιγος ἐδράξω πτεροῦ</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0232,001:143" default="NO"><author>Archil.</author> 143</bibl></cit> (v. συλλαμβάνω II.1). This noise is freq. used as a simile for sweet sounds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Il.</title> 3.151</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0020,002:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hes.</author> <title>Op.</title> 582</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0020,003:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Sc.</title> 393</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0261,001:173" default="NO"><author>Simon.</author> 173</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0261,001:174" default="NO">174</bibl>, etc.; and Plato calls them <foreign lang="greek">οἱ Μουσῶν προφῆται</foreign>, <title>Phdr.</title> 262d; but they also became a prov. for garrulity, <cit><quote lang="greek">λαλεῖν τέττιξ</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0421,001:10:7" default="NO"><author>Aristopho</author> 10.7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="greek">τ. πολλοὶ γινόμενοι νοσῶδες τὸ ἔτος σημαίνουσι</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0093,010:54" default="NO"><author>Thphr.</author> <title>Sign.</title> 54</bibl></cit>. They were thought to sing continually without food or drink, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0019,003:1360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ar.</author> <title>Nu.</title> 1360</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,012:259c" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>Phdr.</title> 259c</bibl>; or on a diet of air and dew, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,014:532b:13" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>HA</title> 532b13</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0005,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Theoc.</author> 4.16</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,7000,001:6:120" default="NO"><title>AP</title> 6.120</bibl> (<author>Leon.</author>), <title>Anacreont.</title> 32, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:660f">2.660f</bibl>. The Greeks ate <foreign lang="greek">τέττιγες</foreign> to whet the appetite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:4:133b" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 4.133b</bibl>, cf. <author>Ar.</author> <title>Frr.</title> 51, 569.4, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0402,001:162:13" default="NO"><author>Alex.</author> 162.13</bibl> (anap.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0405,001:41:59" default="NO"><author>Anaxandr.</author> 41.59</bibl> (anap., unless here the <foreign lang="greek">τέττιξ ἐνάλιος</foreign> is meant, <abbr>v.</abbr> infr. II); and as a medical remedy, <author>Dsc.</author> 2.51, <author>Orib.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 64. </sense>
<sense n="II" id="n103659.1" level="2" opt="n"> (<etym lang="greek" opt="n">τυγχάνω</etym>) <i>attainment, acquisition</i>, opp. <foreign lang="greek">ἔφεσις</foreign>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,138:1071e">2.1071e</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0557,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Arr.</author> <title>Epict.</title> 2.5.8</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0544,002:11:82" default="NO"><author>S.E.</author> <title>M.</title> 11.82</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2000,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Plot.</author> 1.5.2</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2000,001:6:8:5" default="NO">6.8.5</bibl>. </sense>
<sense id="n103724.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>systematic treatment</i>, of grammar, etc., <author>Phld.</author> <title>Rh.</title> 1.128 <author>S.</author> (pl.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> <title>Att.</title> 4.16.3</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0643,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Anon.Lond.</author> 2.18</bibl>, <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,101:514a">2.514a</bibl> (pl.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0544,001:2:205" default="NO"><author>S.E.</author> <title>P.</title> 2.205</bibl>, lamb. <title>Comm.Math.</title> 7, etc.</sense>
<sense id="n103772.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>fatherʼs</i> or <i>motherʼs sister, aunt</i>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0017,009:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Is.</author> 9.19</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0014,027:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>D.</author> 27.14</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0014,043:29" default="NO" valid="yes">43.29</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0541,001:923:5" default="NO"><author>Men.</author> 923.5</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0526,001:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>J.</author> <title>AJ</title> 3.12.1</bibl> (vv. ll. <foreign lang="greek">τιτθίσι, τιθίσι, τιτθαῖς</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0526,001:16:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes">16.10.5</bibl> (vv. ll. <foreign lang="greek">τιτθίδα, τητθίδα</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0526,001:17:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes">17.1.1</bibl> (v.l. τητθίδα, Lat. vers. <i>nutricem</i>), <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,121:838b">2.838b</bibl>, Hierocl.p.61 A. <cit><quote lang="greek">σάρξ</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:689c">2.689c</bibl></cit>; of delirious persons,

<sense n="b" id="n105517.3" level="4" opt="n"> each of two fixed points in the solar year, <i>the solstices,</i> first in <author>Hes.</author>, <cit><quote lang="greek">ἠελίοιο τροπῇς</quote> <i>at the time of the (winter) solstice, Op.</i> 479</cit>; <foreign lang="greek">μετὰ τροπὰς ἠελ.</foreign> ib.564,663 (with <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Dor.</gram></gramGrp> acc. pl. in <foreign lang="greek">-ᾰς</foreign>) <cit><quote lang="greek">; πεδὰ τὰς τροπάς</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0291,001:33:5" default="NO"><author>Alcm.</author> 33.5</bibl></cit>:—later the two solstices were distinguished as <foreign lang="greek">τροπαὶ θεριναί</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">χειμεριναί,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0016,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hdt.</author> 2.19</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0003,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Th.</author> 7.16</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0059,034:767c" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pl.</author> <title>Lg.</title> 767c</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,014:542b:4" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>HA</title> 542b4</bibl> sqq., <author>Gal.</author> 6.405, etc. (rarely in sg., <cit><quote lang="greek">τροπὴ θερινή</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0086,026:364b:2" default="NO"><author>Arist.</author> <title>Mete.</title> 364b2</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,1383,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>Gem.</author> 1.13</bibl>; <div2 id="crosstu^ranneu/w" orig_id="n105956" key="tu^ranneu/w" type="main" opt="n"><head extent="suff" lang="greek" opt="n" orth_orig="τῠρανν-εύω">τυραννεύω</head> and <orth extent="suff" lang="greek" opt="n">τῠρανν-έω</orth>, the former always in <author>Hdt.</author> (v. infr.) and found in <author>Alc.</author> <title>Supp.</title> 28.12 (prob.); both in Trag. and Com., as the metre required, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0011,004:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>S.</author> <title>OT</title> 408</bibl> with <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0011,007:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>OC</title> 449</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0006,003:967" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>E.</author> <title>Med.</title> 967</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0006,015:560" C.</date>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0533,001:337" default="NO"><author>Call.</author> <title>Fr.</title> 337</bibl>:—also <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="dialect" opt="n">Att.</gram></gramGrp> <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">φθοΐς</orth>, <itype lang="greek">ΐδος</itype>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">ἡ</gen>, acc. <cit><quote lang="greek">φθοΐδα</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,7000,001:6:258" default="NO"><title>AP</title> 6.258</bibl></cit> (Adaeus); nom. pl. <foreign lang="greek">φθοΐδες</foreign> or <cit><quote lang="greek">φθοῖδες</quote> <title>IG</title> 1(2).301.103</cit>, 109, 116:— <sense id="n110736.0" n="" level="1" opt="n"><i>a</i> kind of <i>cake,</i> <author>Ar.</author> l.c., <title>GDI</title> l.c., <title>SIG</title> l.c., <author>Chrysipp.Tyan.</author> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:14:647d" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 14.647d</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,2034,003:2:7" default="NO"><author>Porph.</author> <title>Abst.</title> 2.7</bibl>: Lat. abl. pl. <i>pthoibus</i> <title>CIL</title> 6.32323.140, 145 (Rome, <date>i B. C.</date>); nom. <i>fthois = uuum</i> (i.e. <i>libum</i>), <title>Gloss.</title> </sense><sense n="2" id="n110736.1" level="3" opt="n"> Medic., <i>pastille,</i> used for fumigation, <author>Hp.</author> l.c. </sense><sense n="3" id="n110736.2" level="3" opt="n"> <i>bar</i> of precious metal, <foreign lang="greek">χρυσίου Σκαπτησυλικοῦ</foreign> <title>IG</title> l.c., cf. 22.1443.20, al.; but <foreign lang="greek">φ. χρυσίου</foreign> gold-<i>dust,</i> <author>Hsch.</author> </sense><sense n="II" id="n110736.3" level="2" opt="n"> a kind of <i>cup,</i> prob. the same as <foreign lang="greek">φιάλη ὀμφαλωτή,</foreign> <author>Eup.</author> l.c., cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:11:502b" default="NO"><author>Ath.</author> 11.502b</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">φθόεις κυκλοτερεῖς</foreign> ib. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0008,001:489d" default="NO">489d</bibl>.</sense></div2>

 

<cit><quote lang="greek">φ. τοῦ γάμου ὑπὸ δαιμονίου τινός</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,114:772b">2.772b</bibl></cit>.
<cit><quote lang="greek">ἕξις</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,112:682d">2.682d</bibl></cit>;

(Pap.); this contradiction in the early evidence is unexplained; the form <foreign lang="greek">φιδ-</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">φειδ-</foreign> is corroborated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,004:12" default="NO"><author>Plu.</author> <title>Lyc.</title> 12</bibl>, where it is suggested that the word comes from <foreign lang="greek">φιλία</foreign> with substitution of <itype lang="greek" opt="n">δ</itype> for <itype lang="greek" opt="n">λ</itype>, or from <foreign lang="greek">φειδώ,</foreign> or from <foreign lang="greek">*ἐδίτια</foreign> (‘eatings’, cf. <foreign lang="greek">ἐδωδή</foreign>) with prefixed <foreign lang="greek">φ.</foreign> Codd. have <foreign lang="greek">φιδίτια</foreign> (or <itype lang="greek" opt="n">ον</itype>) in <author>Arist.</author> <title>Pol.</title> (v.l. φιλίτια), <author>Plu.</author> (exc. <foreign lang="greek">φιτιδίοις</foreign> <abbr>v.</abbr> l. in <title>Cleom.</title> l.c., <foreign lang="greek">φιλιτίων</foreign> all codd. in <title>Phoc.</title> l.c., <foreign lang="greek">φιλίτια</foreign> all codd. in 2.714b, <foreign lang="greek">φιλέστιον</foreign> in 2.697e), <author>Hsch.</author>; <foreign lang="greek">φειδίτια</foreign> in <author>Paus.</author>, <author>Ath.</author> (who cites <author>Antiph.</author>, <author>Dicaearch.Hist.</author>, <author>Phylarch.</author>), <author>Eust.</author>; <foreign lang="greek">φιλίτια</foreign> in <author>X.</author> (v.l. φιδίτια in <title>HG</title> l.c.), <author>Arist.</author> <title>Rh.</title> (<foreign lang="greek">φιδίτια</foreign> Sch.), <author>D.H.</author>, <author>D.Chr.</author>, <author>Philostr.</author>, <author>Them.</author>, <author>Suid.</author>; <i>philitiis</i> in <author>Cic.</author>) </sense>

<sense n="2" id="n112367.2" level="3" opt="n"> <i>to be thoughtful</i> or <i>anxious,</i> <foreign lang="greek">πεφροντικὸς βλέπεις</foreign> you look <i>careworn,</i> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0006,002:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>E.</author> <title>Alc.</title> 773</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="greek">τίς δʼ ἔστιν ὁ . . φροντίζων;</quote> <author>Phryn.</author></cit> Com.21; <foreign lang="greek">τὸ πεφροντικός,</foreign> as <pos opt="n">Subst.</pos>, <i>care, thought,</i> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,129:983b">2.983b</bibl>. </sense>

<sense n="B" id="n113388.24" level="1" opt="n"> <orth extent="full" lang="greek" opt="n">Χάρις</orth>, <gen lang="greek" opt="n">ἡ</gen>, as a mythological pr. n. declined like χάρις, save that the acc. is generally <foreign lang="greek">Χάριτα</foreign> (exc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,7000,001:5:148" default="NO"><title>AP</title> 5.148</bibl> (<author>Mel.</author>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0062,068:17:1" default="NO"><author>Luc.</author> <title>DDeor.</title> 17[15].1</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0525,001:9:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Paus.</author> 9.35.4</bibl>): poet. dat. pl. <cit><quote lang="greek">Χαρίτεσσι</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0012,001:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><title>Il.</title> 17.51</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0033,003:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Pi.</author> <title>N.</title> 9.54</bibl>; <sense n="II" id="n115374.6" level="2" opt="n"> rarely in <gramGrp opt="n"><gram type="voice" opt="n">Pass.</gram></gramGrp>, <i>to be touched,</i> of the star-fish, <cit><quote lang="greek">ἐνδίδωσι τὸ σῶμα καὶ περιορᾷ ψαυόμενον ὑπὸ τῶν παρατρεχόντων</quote> <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,129:978b">2.978b</bibl></cit>, cf. 951d (if the comma be placed before, not after, <foreign lang="greek">οὐσίας</foreign>) <foreign lang="greek">; ὅσοι ὑπὸ τῶν Ἀμινναίων</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">οἴνων</foreign>) <foreign lang="greek"> ψαύονται κεφαλῆς</foreign> those who <i>are affected</i> in the head . . , <author>Dsc.</author> 5.19.—The word is very rare in early Prose, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0028,003:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Antipho</author> 3.3.5</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0032,002:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>X.</author> <title>Mem.</title> 1.4.12</bibl>: freq. later, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0543,001:1:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plb.</author> 1.13.8</bibl>, al., <author>Plu.</author> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0007,109:589f">2.589f</bibl>, al.</sense>
